message_1: What is the closure of the set A = {1, 2, 3} in the topological space (X, τ), where X = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and τ is the discrete topology?
message_2:
In a discrete topology, every subset of the topological space is an open set. Therefore, the closure of any set A in a discrete topological space is the set A itself. 

So, the closure of the set A = {1, 2, 3} in the topological space (X, τ), where X = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and τ is the discrete topology, is A = {1, 2, 3}.
